Assuming an intervention in the form of a linear operator \\( L(z) = Dz \\), with \\( D \\) a constant matrix applied at a certain time \\( t_k \\), will the final state \\( z(T) \\) for \\( T > t_k \\) depend solely on the initial matrix \\( M \\) and not on \\( N \\) or \\( D \\)?
Explanation: The intervention of \\( L(z) \\) at \\( t_k \\) introduces a new dynamic in the evolution of \\( z(t) \\), making the endpoint \\( z(T) \\) influenced by the matrices \\( M \\), \\( N \\), and \\( D \\). The interaction of these matrices and the timing of the intervention significantly affect the trajectory and the eventual outcome at time T.
